purpose: Provides logging functionality that writes timestamped messages to a log file in the workspace's .shadow/logs directory
userVisibleActions: Log files are created in the workspace's .shadow/logs directory
A shadow-watch.log file accumulates timestamped entries of extension activity
Logs persist across sessions for debugging and auditing purposes
developerVisibleActions: Developers can call SWLogger.log() to write timestamped messages to the log file
Developers can call SWLogger.section() to add formatted section headers to organize log entries
Logging fails silently if the workspace is not available or file operations fail
Log entries include ISO timestamp format for precise timing information

keyFunctions.name: log
keyFunctions.desc: Writes a timestamped message to the shadow-watch.log file
keyFunctions.inputs: message: string - the text to log
keyFunctions.outputs: void - no return value, writes to file system

keyFunctions.name: section
keyFunctions.desc: Adds a formatted section header to the log for organizing related entries
keyFunctions.outputs: void - writes formatted header to log

keyFunctions.name: getLogPath
keyFunctions.desc: Determines the full file path where logs should be written
keyFunctions.outputs: string | null - the log file path or null if no workspace is open

keyFunctions.name: ensureDir
keyFunctions.desc: Creates the directory structure if it doesn't exist
keyFunctions.inputs: dir: string - directory path to create

intent: This file exists to provide centralized, file-based logging for the extension, allowing developers to track extension behavior and debug issues by writing persistent logs to the workspace. It solves the problem of needing visibility into extension operations without relying on console output or VS Code's output panel alone.
